items.name: Medusa and Athena - Ancient Greek Goddesses - Greek Mythology

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

Medusa and Athena - Ancient Greek Goddesses - Greek Mythology

In later myths (mainly in Ovid) Medusa was the only Gorgon to possess snake locks because they were a punishment from Athena. Accordingly, Ovid relates that the once beautiful mortal was punished by Athena with a hideous appearance and loathsome snakes for hair for having been raped in Athena's temple by Poseidon.

items.name: Apollo and Cassandra | Athena and Poseidon - Ancient Greek Myths - Cartoons

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

Apollo and Cassandra | Athena and Poseidon - Ancient Greek Myths - Cartoons

APOLLO AND CASSANDRA
Cassandra was given the gift of prophecy, but was also cursed by the god Apollo so that her accurate prophecies would not be believed. Many versions of the myth relate that she incurred the god's wrath by refusing him sex, after promising herself to him in exchange for the power of prophecy.

ATHENA AND POSEIDON
Athena and Poseidon vied for control of Athens and its surrounding territory, Attica. The contest took place on the Acropolis. Poseidon struck the rock with his trident and produced a salt spring or a horse. Athena brought forth an olive tree from the ground by the touch of her spear and she was proclaimed the victor.

items.name: The Story of Persephone & Pandora's Box - Greek Mythology Stories -Myths & Legends of Ancient Greece

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

The Story of Persephone & Pandora's Box - Greek Mythology Stories -Myths & Legends of Ancient Greece

PANDORA'S BOX
Zeus sent Pandora down to earth and gave her as a present to Prometheus' brother, Epimetheus. Zeus told Epimetheus that he should marry Pandora. Also, Zeus sent Pandora with a little box, with a big lock on it (Actually in the earliest versions of this story it is a sealed pottery vase)

PERSEPHONE
The story of Persephone, the sweet daughter of goddess Demeter who was kidnapped by Hades and later became the Queen of the Underworld, is known all over the world. It is actually the way of the ancient Greeks to explain the change of the seasons, the eternal cycle of the Nature's death and rebirth.

items.name: David and Goliath | Popular Bible Stories I Holy Tales - Children's Bible Stories |Animated Cartoons

sections.Creator's Notes:
Watch other amazing Bible Stories like Birth of Jesus, Cain and Abel, Noahs Ark, Joseph, Moses, Adam and Eve and many more - https://goo.gl/gjBdtQ

Goliath (/ɡəˈlaɪəθ/; Hebrew: גָּלְיָת, Modern Golyat, Tiberian Golyāṯ; Arabic: جالوت Ǧulyāt (Christian term), Ǧālūt (Qur'anic term)) of Gath (one of five city-states of the Philistines) is the Biblical warrior defeated by the young David in the Book of Samuel. Post-Classical Jewish traditions stressed his status as the representative of paganism, in contrast to David, the champion of the God of Israel. Christian tradition sees David's battle with Goliath the victory of God's king over the enemies of God's helpless people as a prefiguring of Jesus' victory over sin on the cross and the Church's victory over Satan.

The phrase "David and Goliath" (or "David versus Goliath") has taken on a more popular meaning, denoting an underdog situation, a contest where a smaller, weaker opponent faces a much bigger, stronger adversary.

items.name: The Story of Medusa | Zeus, Hera and Little Io - Greek Myth & Ancient Greece For Kids

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

The Story of Medusa | Zeus, Hera and Little Io - Greek Myth & Ancient Greece For Kids

Zeus was the king of all the gods. Zeus ruled the entire universe - no one was mightier than the mighty Zeus.  Zeus was not afraid of anything except possibly his wife, the horrible Hera.

Magically, Zeus was the only god who could throw lightning bolts. He could shape shift, and look like anybody. He could throw his voice and sound like anybody.

 As king, he had powers that came from being king of all the gods. These were powers of government. He could give other gods titles and jobs. He could take those titles and jobs away. He could direct other gods, like any leader. His was an elected position. There were 12 gods on the council. They could have voted someone else king. But they never did. And Zeus never retired.

There are many myths, of course, about the king of all the Greek gods.

items.name: Mythic Warriors: Guardians of the Legend - King Midas: The Golden Touch - Season 2 Episode 12

sections.Creator's Notes: Mythic Warriors (also known as Mythic Warriors: Guardians of the Legend) is an animated television series, which featured retellings of popular Greek myths that were altered so as to be appropriate for younger audiences, produced by Nelvana and Marathon Media. Two seasons of episodes were produced in 1998 and 1999; then aired alongside reruns until 2000, when CBS' abolition of its children's programming resulted in its cancellation. The series was based on the book series Myth Men Guardians of the Legend (Myth Men) written in 1996 and 1997 by Laura Geringer and illustrated by Peter Bollinger.

items.name: Mythic Warriors Guardians of the Legend Damon And Pythias part 1.flv

sections.Creator's Notes: Damon and Pythias were two fast friends, always faithful to each other. As young boys, they anger the lonely and friendless Prince Dionus who under the influence of his court adviser, has been brought up to believe that no one can be trusted and that true friendship does not exist.

items.name: Theseus & The Minotaur | Daedalus and Icarus | Greek Mythology

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

Theseus & The Minotaur | Daedalus, and Icarus | Greek Mythology | Bedtime Stories

Icarus, the son of Daedalus who created the maze that held the Minotaur was given wings which allowed him to fly away from the Island of Crete. He was told not to fly too near the Sun nor too close to the water, as these wings were driven by the interaction of Sun and Water.

The Minotaur and the Labyrinth of Crete. ... The third year, Theseus, son of Aegeus decided to be one of the seven young men that would go to Crete, in order to kill the Minotaur and end the human sacrifices to the monster. King Aegeus tried to make him change his mind but Theseus was determined to slay the Minotaur.

items.name: King Midas and the Golden Touch - A Greek Tale

sections.Creator's Notes:
Based on a story by Lin and Don Donn - https://ancienthistory.mrdonn.org/myths.html, used with permission.

King Midas and the Golden Touch - A Greek Tale

The Golden Touch. There was once a king named Midas who did a good deed for a Satyr and was granted a wish by the God of wine, Dionysus. For his wish, Midas asked that whatever he touched would turn to gold. ... Midas' beloved daughter, seeing his dismay, threw her arms about him to comfort him, and, she too turned to gold ...

items.name: Mythic Warriors Guardians of the Legend: Atalanta: The Wild Girl. Part 3

sections.Creator's Notes: Atalanta, abandoned as a baby, is raised by bears and becomes the "wild girl" protector of the animals. Though she hates man for his hunting ways, when Prince Meleager meets her, for the first time Atalanta begins to see her "human" side. But while love is budding Meleager and Atalanta, Artemis, goddess of the hunt, becomes jealous of this mortal girl who dares to challenge her rule over the hunting grounds of earth.

items.name: Mythic Warriors Guardians of the Legend - Persephone and the Winter Seeds part 1

sections.Creator's Notes:
Mythic Warriors: Guardians of the Legend) was a Canadian-produced animated television series that was a fixture of CBS' Saturday-morning cartoon lineup. The show featured retellings of popular Greek myths that were altered so as to be appropriate for younger audiences. 

Two seasons of episodes were produced in 1998 and 1999; then aired alongside reruns until 2000, when CBS' abolition of its children's programming resulted in its cancellation

Persephone, daughter of Demeter (goddess of the harvest), longs to be free of her overprotective mother. When she runs away to find adventure, Persephone stops for a drink beside an ebony pool, unaware that she is being watched by the god Hades. Having lived his life in dreary darkness, Hades falls instantly in love with this bright and cheery girl who promises to visit the lonely god, and to bring warmth to his cold heart. .

items.name: Mythic Warriors Guardians of the Legend Eros and Psyche part 1

sections.Creator's Notes:
Mythic Warriors: Guardians of the Legend) was a Canadian-produced animated television series that was a fixture of CBS' Saturday-morning cartoon lineup. The show featured retellings of popular Greek myths that were altered so as to be appropriate for younger audiences. 

Two seasons of episodes were produced in 1998 and 1999; then aired alongside reruns until 2000, when CBS' abolition of its children's programming resulted in its cancellation

Psyche, the most beautiful princess in Greece, is sought after by everyone. Eros falls in love with Psyche for her kind and caring nature, not after her beauty. He decides to see if she will fall in love with him based on his personality by turning himself into an invisible host who will not reveal his identity. When Psyche's sister starts filling her mind with awful ideas about her invisible suitor, she decides to covertly see who he is, only to discover an angry Eros. Psyche must find a way to regain his love back, even if it means losing her beauty.

items.name: Mythic Warriors Guardians of the Legend   Hercules And The Golden Apples part 1

sections.Creator's Notes: Having never forgiven Hercules for challenging the gods, a vengeful Hera hires centaur Nessus to wound Daneira, Hercules' one true love, with a poisoned arrow. When Hercules tries to draw out the poison, he becomes infected, too. Knowing that Daneira will soon die, Hercules pleads to the gods for help, and he is answered by Hera, who tells him that only a golden apple from her Garden of Hesperides can cure Daneira.
